results.title: When parents grow old: extract from I never sang for
results.creator_credit: Gilbert Cates, Columbia Pictures and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Searching for values: a film anthology”.
Edited from the motion picture ‘I never sang for my Father” starring Gene Hackman and Melvyn Douglas, this tells the story of a young man who must decide betweeb caring for his elderly wodowed father and marriage. The themes of responisibility to the aged, fear of growing old, and society’s treatment of the elderly are explored.

results.title: Violence: just for fun
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Searching for values: a film anthology”.
Uses extracts from the feature film “Barabbas” (produced by Dino de Laurentiis, directed by Richard Fleischer) to explore the theme of finding excitement and entertainment in the spectacle of violence - in this case, gladiators killing each other in battle. Easily accepting violence as an enjoyable aspect of ‘civilised life’, the Romans applaud the destruction of human lives and show no mercy to those defeated in combat. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Trouble with the law
results.brief_description:
Episode of series “Searching for values: a film anthology”
Edited from the feature film ‘Pursuit of happiness’, this extract shows how the legal process and justice are not always synonymous. A college student involved in a car accident rejects the standards by which the court finds him guilty and decides that justice has not been served.
Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Pride and principle
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Searching for values: a film anthology”.
An extract from the feature film “Bridge on the River Kwai” in which Sir Alec Guiness as the Commanding Officer refuses to give in to the Japanese over the issue of not allowing his officers to work. Raises issues surrounding pride and its consequences. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Politics, power and the public good
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Searching for values: a film anthology”.
A long-term popular politician, proud of “getting things done for the people”, ruthlessly fights to retain his office with a panoply of unethical tactics and henchmen. Deeply entrenched in corruption, the politician retains his office due to the efforts of his supporters who organised a mass movement of popular support for him. Edited from the film “All the King’s Men” produced and directed by Robert Rossen.

results.title: Search goes full circle
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Search”.
This episode of the British television series “Search” looks at recycling waste materials in order to be more environmentally aware. Shows how to compost, make recyled paper and discusses the recycling of items such as cans, and second hand clothing which is made into a felt-like material and used as filling

results.title: Screens and screams [the movie]
results.brief_description: In October 2002, just before opening at Federation Square, ACMI and the City of Melbourne asked the Kids Own Publishing Partnership from Ireland to run a workshop for over 300 primary school students from 8 schools in the city. Each group of kids had a different job to do - some made and filmed shadow puppets, some acted, some digitally animated, and some created an original soundtrack with artists from the Melbourne Symphony Orchestra. The result was the very first Made @ACMI student movie ‘Screens and Screams’
